svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - June 22 2019

title: "Week in Ethereum News
June 22, 2019" date: "2019-06-23"
Ethereum News and Links
Layer 1
• What’s New in Eth2 . Since it is the first issue in awhile, it’s a good summary of where Eth2 is at.
• Nimbus Eth2 client dev update - up to date on spec. Nimbus and SigmaPrime’s Lighthouse clients are
talking to each other.
• Eth2 client interoperability plan
• Near-instant transaction confirmation via staggered shard block production
• CBC Casper: efficient LMD GHOST
Layer 2
• Phonon Network : scalable, private payment system using Grid+’s SafeCards. Alex and Karl also
discuss Phonon on Into the Ether
• Connext to release single-node v2.0 on Counterfactual in July, followed by multihop in Q3
• An overview of channels, Plasma and rollups layer2 scaling
• Latest Plasma implementers call
Stuff for developers
• EthereumJS VM v4-beta a rewrite in TypeScript
• Gas exactimation in Ganache
• Tutorial: implement an oracle in Solidity
• The Alethio API . Amberdata compares its API to its competitors
• Loredana’s demo of a file System with on-chain semantic search on dType, Ethereum
• Host your app with IPFS+ENS and access it via EthDNS
• 8Pay for infinitely recurring subscriptions
• BurnerWallet Factory - make your own in a few minutes
• Cloudflare's Ethereum Gateway
Ecosystem
• EF-supported teams: development update . Extensive updates from each EF team.
• Eth.wiki
• Argent unveils Hopper , “a zero-knowledge-based trustless mixer” to deposit 1 eth and withdraw to
different address
• Better UX for noobs: gas spectrum transactions (sign multiple transactions with a spectrum of gas
prices)
• Shiftly - a bit like old-school Shapeshift using dexes
Enterprise
• Ethereum Foundation joins Hyperledger and Enterprise Ethereum Alliance
• Gartner: 7 mistakes to avoid in enterprise blockchain
• Quorum v2.2.4
• See also below: MetLife live on Eth mainnet
Governance and Standards
• Latest core devs call . Tim Beiko’s live tweetstorm notes going through proposed EIPs. Accepted for
Istanbul: EIP2024 blake2b precompile and EIP1702 generalized account versioning
• EIP2124 : Zero RTT chain compatibility check
• EIP2123 : State-based Hard Fork Signaling
• ERC2126 : Signature Type Recognition
• Final: EIP1155 Multi token standard
• Last call: EIP685 chainID for JSON-RPC and EIP1344 chainID opcode
Live on mainnet
• Insurance giant MetLife is live on mainnet with a pilot program “to help loved ones quickly
determine if the deceased was protected with a policy and automatically file a claim”
• Ethsites , a censorship-resistant “registry of websites stored on the Ethereum blockchain” available
through a Javascript snippet
• Treum (formerly Viant) live on mainnet tracking and tracing commercial organic hemp
Application layer
• Augur v2 to integrate bZx for margin trading
• First 3rd party casino from RaketheRake goes live on FunFair
• Pay as you use in Golem , necessary in gWasm
• Etherisc and Oxfam going live with insurance product for Sri Lankan farmers. Oxfam with ConsenSys
and Sempo also trials Dai for aid in Vanatu
• Dharma now offers customizable loans to pick your own terms.
• Dai Stability Fee up for a vote on going to 17.5%
• William Shatner isn’t just involved with Mattereum, he’s founding a company to use Mattereum to
track memorabilia provenance from creation
Interviews, Podcasts, Videos, Talks
• Austin Griffith on Hashing It Out and Wizard of Dapps
• Grid+’s Alex Miller and Karl Kreder on Into the Ether
• Darma’s Andrew Keys and James Slazas on ChainReaction
• Augur’s Alex Chapman on NEAR’s Whiteboard series
• Maker’s Mariano Conti on POV Crypto
• Uniswap’s Hayden Adams on Epicenter
Tokens / Business / Regulation
• Sensitivity analysis of Status sticker markets
• Two year retrospective on CryptoPunks . Last month the busiest since Jan 2018.
• YouNow/Props is going to do a Reg A+ “offering” in order to give away Props . I wonder how many
millions they had to spend in order to convince the SEC to let them give away tokens.
• ACTUS and Polymath integration to offer nearly 100% of all financial instruments on Polymath
• FATF international body wants countries to mandate sharing requirements for crypto exchanges
General
• Messaging app Line is near approval for a crypto exchange in Japan
• Learning cryptography: finite fields from Loopring
• Facebook’s Libra got announced this week . Protolambda compares Libra and says what they got wrong
vis a vis Eth1 and Eth2
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new in bold ) :
• June 24- July 10 - Gitcoin’s Beyond Blockchain virtual hackathon
• June 25-27 - EthPlanet hackathon (Beijing)
• July 3-5 - WindingTree’s HackTravel (Lisbon)
• July 19 - BuildETH (San Francisco)
• July 19-21 - State of Scale (Los Angeles)
• July 22-23 - Buidl 2019 (Seoul)
• Aug 2-4 - ETHIndia (Bangalore)
• Aug 2-4 - TruffleCon (Redmond)
• Aug 21-23 - Dappcon (Berlin)
• Aug 23-25 - ETHBerlin
• Sep 3 - Deadline to apply for EU Horizon Prize . 1m € each to 5 "Blockchains for Social Good"
projects
• Sep 6-8 - EthBoston
• Sep 15 - Augur v1 cutoff
• Sep 15 - Ethereal Tel Aviv
• Sep 15-16- StarkWare sessions (Tel Aviv)
• Oct 8-11 - DeVcon (Osaka)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own 100% Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been me.
If you're unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this issue, feel free to
tweet at me .
It’s annoying how many link to the old URL. This is the new one: weekinethereumnews.com
Archive on the web if you’re linking to it:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-june-22-2019/
Follow me on Twitter , because most of what is linked here gets tweeted first: @evan_van_ness
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ?”
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive the weekly email
